data.title: Simeon II, Tsar of Bulgaria
data.meta_description: Simeon II, Tsar of Bulgaria (born Simeon, Prince of Turnovo on 16 June 1937) is the current reigning Tsar of Bulgaria as the only son of Tsar Boris III of Bulgaria and Princess Giovanna of Italy. Simeon was only six years old when his father died in 1943. For the next twelve years, his mother...
data.text:
Simeon II, Tsar of Bulgaria (born Simeon, Prince of Turnovo on 16 June 1937) is the current reigning Tsar of Bulgaria as the only son of Tsar Boris III of Bulgaria and Princess Giovanna of Italy.

Life[]

Simeon was only six years old when his father died in 1943. For the next twelve years, his mother, Dowager Tsaritsa Giovanna, and uncle, Kyril, Prince of Preslav, led a regency council in Simeon's stead.

Simeon was coronated and officially took over ruling the kingdom on his eighteenth birthday in 1955. He is currently the longest-reigning monarch in Europe.

Marriage and Issue[]

On 13 October 1961, Simeon's engagement to Spanish noblewoman Margarita Gomez-Acebo y Cejuela was announced. The couple had been introduced at the 1960 wedding of Margarita's friend, Fabiola de Mora y Aragon, and King Baudouin of Belgium. They were married in Sofia on 21 January 1962.

The couple have five children, Kardam, Kyril, Kubrat, Konstantin-Assen, and Kalina.

Residences[]

Titles and Honours[]

1937-1943 Simeon, Prince of Turnovo

1943-present Simeon II, Tsar of Bulgaria

National Honours[]

Order of Cyril and Methodius (1955)

Order of St. Alexander (1955)

Royal Order of Bravery (1955)

Foreign Honours[]

TBD
